t: Isaiah 45
God Uses Cyrus

Thus*pn says the Lord*s to Cyrus His anointed, Whom*ln I have taken by the right hand, To*ln subdue nations before him And*ln to loose the loins of kings; To*ln open doors before him so that gates will not be shut:
“I*ln will go before you and make the rough places smooth; I*ln will shatter the doors of bronze and cut through their iron bars.
I*ln will give you the treasures of darkness And*ln hidden wealth of secret places, So*ln that you may know that it is I, The*ln Lord,*s the God of Israel, who calls you by your name.
For*ln the sake of Jacob My servant, And*ln Israel My chosen one,*i I*ln have also called you by your name; I*ln have given you a title of honor Though*ln you have not known Me.
I*ln am the Lord,*s and there is no other; Besides*ln Me there is no God. I*ln will gird you, though you have not known Me;
That*ln men may know from the rising to the setting of the sun That*ln there is no one besides Me. I*ln am the Lord,*s and there is no other,
The*ln One forming light and creating darkness, Causing*ln well-being and creating calamity; I*ln am the Lord*s who does all these.
God’s Supreme Power

“Drip*pn down, O heavens, from above, And*ln let the clouds pour down righteousness; Let*ln the earth open up and salvation bear fruit, And*ln righteousness spring up with it. I,*ln the Lord,*s have created it.

“Woe*ln to the*i one*i who quarrels with his Maker— An*ln earthenware vessel among the vessels of earth! Will*ln the clay say to the potter, ‘What are you doing?’ Or*ln the thing you are making say,*i ‘He has no hands’?
Woe*ln to him who says to a father, ‘What are you begetting?’ Or*ln to a woman, ‘To what are you giving birth?’ ”
Thus*p says the Lord,*s the Holy One of Israel, and his Maker: “Ask*pn Me about the things to come concerning My sons, And*ln you shall commit to Me the work of My hands.
It*ln is I who made the earth, and created man upon it. I*ln stretched out the heavens with My hands And*ln I ordained all their host.
I*ln have aroused him in righteousness And*ln I will make all his ways smooth; He*ln will build My city and will let My exiles go free, Without*ln any payment or reward,” says the Lord*s of hosts.

Thus*p says the Lord,*s “The*pn products of Egypt and the merchandise of Cush And*ln the Sabeans, men of stature, Will*ln come over to you and will be yours; They*ln will walk behind you, they will come over in chains And*ln will bow down to you; They*ln will make supplication to you: ‘Surely,*ln God is with you, and there is none else, No*ln other God.’ ”
Truly,*ln You are a God who hides Himself, O*ln God of Israel, Savior!
They*ln will be put to shame and even humiliated, all of them; The*ln manufacturers of idols will go away together in humiliation.
Israel*ln has been saved by the Lord*s With*ln an everlasting salvation; You*ln will not be put to shame or humiliated To*ln all eternity.

For*p thus says the Lord,*s who created the heavens (He is the God who formed the earth and made it, He established it and*i did not create it a waste place, but*i formed it to be inhabited), “I*pn am the Lord,*s and there is none else.

I*ln have not spoken in secret, In*ln some dark land; I*ln did not say to the offspring of Jacob, ‘Seek*ln Me in a waste place’; I,*ln the Lord,*s speak righteousness, Declaring*ln things that are upright.
“Gather*ln yourselves and come; Draw*ln near together, you fugitives of the nations; They*ln have no knowledge, Who*ln carry about their wooden idol And*ln pray to a god who cannot save.

Declare*ln and set forth your*i case;*i Indeed,*ln let them consult together. Who*ln has announced this from of old? Who*ln has long since declared it? Is*ln it not I, the Lord?*s And*ln there is no other God besides Me, A*ln righteous God and a Savior; There*ln is none except Me.
Turn*ln to Me and be saved, all the ends of the earth; For*ln I am God, and there is no other.
I*ln have sworn by Myself, The*ln word has gone forth from My mouth in righteousness And*ln will not turn back, That*ln to Me every knee will bow, every tongue will swear allegiance.*i
They*ln will say of Me, ‘Only in the Lord*s are righteousness and strength.’ Men*ln will come to Him, And*ln all who were angry at Him will be put to shame.
In*ln the Lord*s all the offspring of Israel Will*ln be justified and will glory.”
